sen.j: 伊東茂右衛門（いとう もえもん、嘉永4年（1851年、1852年） - 没年不明）は、日本の著述家。
sen.e: Moemon ITO (1851 or 1852-year of death unknown) is a Japanese writer.
Moemon ITO (1851 or 1852-year of death unknown) was a Japanese writer.
Moemon ITO (1851 or 1852 - year of death unknown) was a Japanese writer.

sen.j: 号は竹山。
sen.e: Go(second name or alias) is Chikuzan.
Go(second name or alias) is Chikuzan.
Go(second name or alias) is Chikuzan.

sen.j: 経済学の著書が多い。
sen.e: He produced lots of books in economics.
He produced lots of books in economics.
He produced lots of books in economics.

sen.j: 嘉永4年（1851年,1852年）、豊後国速見郡立石に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born at Tateishi, Hayami County, Bungo Province in 1851 or 1852.
sen.cmt: 立石→Tateishi (立石) ［角川日本地名大辞典 角川書店］
sen.e: He was born in Tateishi, Hayami County, Bungo Province in 1851 or 1852.
sen.cmt: 立石は村または町なのでinとしました。
sen.e: He was born in Tateishi, Hayami County, Bungo Province in 1851 or 1852.

sen.j: 豊前国中津市の学校で学を修め、明治10年（1877年）に上京して福澤諭吉の書生となる。
sen.e: He studied at a school of Nakatsu City, Buzen Province and he moved to Tokyo in 1877 to become shosei (a student who is given room and board in exchange for performing domestic duties) of Yukichi FUKUZAWA.

He studied at a school of Nakatsu City, Buzen Province and he moved to Tokyo in 1877 to become shosei (a student who is given room and board in exchange for performing domestic duties) of Yukichi FUKUZAWA.

He studied at a school of Nakatsu City, Buzen Province and he moved to Tokyo in 1877 to become shosei (a student who is given room and board in exchange for performing domestic duties) of Yukichi FUKUZAWA.

sen.j: 福沢は伊東の将来に期待し、あえて親しくはしなかった。
sen.e: FUKUZAWA was hopeful about his future and pretended not to be close with him.
FUKUZAWA was hopeful about his future and pretended not to be close with him.
FUKUZAWA was hopeful about his future and pretended not to be close with him.

sen.j: 諸芸に通じ、漢籍、洋書を読み、数理も得意とし、詩、和歌、絵画、俳諧などもできたが、経済学に最も長けた。
sen.e: He was familiar with some arts and he read Chinese classic books or foreign books, and he has was good at not only mathmatics but also poetry, Waka (Japanese poetry), paintings and Haikai (Japanese seventeen-syllable verse), but what he showed his great ability most is economics.

He was familiar with some arts and he read Chinese classic books and foreign books, in addition, he was good at not only mathmatics but also poetry, Waka (Japanese poetry), paintings and Haikai (Japanese seventeen-syllable verse), but what he showed his great ability most was economics.
sen.cmt: or → andand → in additionis economics → was economics
sen.e: He was familiar with some arts and he read Chinese classic books and foreign books, in addition, he was good at not only mathmatics but also poetry, Waka (Japanese poetry), paintings and Haikai (Japanese seventeen-syllable verse), but what he showed his great ability most was economics.

sen.j: 生活では綿の着物を着て倹約し、数万円（当時の金額）の富を築いたという。
sen.e: It was said that, in his life, he saved his money wearing kimono made of cotton and earned tens of thousands of yen (the value at the time).
He was said to lead a frugal life, wearing kimono made of cotton for example, and earned tens of thousands of yen (the value at the time).
sen.cmt: 前半を簡潔にしました。For exampleを追加しました。
sen.e: He was said to lead a frugal life, wearing kimono made of cotton for example, and earned tens of thousands of yen (the value at the time).

sen.j: 福沢諭吉が創刊した新聞『時事新報』の編集長で、広告の主任だった。
sen.e: He was a chief editor of Jiji Shinpo published by FUKUZAWA and he was a director of advertisement.
He was a chief editor of "Jiji Shinpo" founded by FUKUZAWA and also served as a director of advertisement.
sen.cmt: " "を追加しました。Published → foundedhe was → also served as
sen.e: He was a chief editor of "Jiji Shinpo" founded by FUKUZAWA and also served as a director of advertisement.

sen.j: 経済学関連の著書以外に、漢文による見聞録、詩集、和歌がある。
sen.e: In addition to his economics-related books, he also produced kenbunroku written in Kanji character, poetry, and created Waka.
sen.cmt: 見聞録→kenbunroku （見聞録） ［定訳不明］
sen.e: In addition to economics-related books, he also left kenbunroku (essays) written in Kanbun (classical Chinese), poetry, and created Waka.
sen.cmt: hisを削除しました。Produced → leftKanji character → Kanbun (classical Chinese)
sen.e: In addition to economics-related books, he also left kenbunroku (essays) written in Kanbun (classical Chinese), poetry, and created Waka.

sen.j: 著書
sen.e: His Books
Books
Books

sen.j: 『海産論』（ピーター・ランド・シモントス原著、浜野定四郎と共訳、開拓使・出版、1881年2月）
sen.e: "Kaisanron" (original author, Simmonds, Peter Lund; joint auther, Sadashiro HAMANO, published by Kaitakushi, February 1881)

sen.e: "Kaisanron" (original author, Simmonds, Peter Lund; joint translator, Sadashiro HAMANO, published by Kaitakushi, February 1881)

sen.j: 『中外蚕事要録』（第1版・1886年3月、第2版・1887年1月、第3版・1888年2月）
sen.e: "Cyugaisanjiyoroku" (first edition, March 1886; second edition, January 1887; third edition, february 1888)

sen.e: "Cyugaisanjiyoroku (Outline of sericultural industry)" (first edition, March 1886; second edition, January 1887; third edition, february 1888)

sen.j: 『明治後期産業発達史資料. 第167巻』（竜渓書舎、1993年1月）に収録
sen.e: It was contained in "Meijikokisangyohattatsusiryo vol. 167" (Ryukeishosha, january 1993)
sen.cmt: 竜渓書舎→Ryukeishosha (竜渓書舎) ［国立国会図書館蔵書検索システムNDL-OPAC http://opac.ndl.go.jp/］単独で「～に収録」と書かれている箇所の意味が不明。大阪市立中央図書館司書によると前項目の『中外蚕事要録』が『明治後期産業発達史資料. 第167巻』に収められている模様（データ等で目視確認できず）。
sen.e: It was contained in "Meijikokisangyohattatsusiryo (Historical materials about industry in the late Meiji period) vol. 167" (Ryukeishosha, january 1993)
sen.cmt: (Historical materials about industry in the late Meiji period)を追加しました。
sen.e: It was contained in "Meijikokisangyohattatsusiryo (Historical materials about industry in the late Meiji period) vol. 167" (Ryukeishosha, january 1993)
